channel.title: BBC News - Home

item.title: Plymouth shooting: Multiple fatalities in Keyham
item.description: A local MP says the shooting is not terror-related and the suspect is not on the run.

item.title: Afghanistan: UK troops sent to get Britons out as Taliban advances
item.description: Around 600 troops will be deployed on a short-term basis after the Taliban seized several cities.

item.title: Afghanistan: Major cities fall to Taliban amid heavy fighting
item.description: Militants now control many of Afghanistan's key regional cities, including Herat and Ghazni.

item.title: Record GCSE results after second year of no exams
item.description: Record high GCSE grades in a second year of exams disrupted by the pandemic.

item.title: Actress Una Stubbs dies aged 84
item.description: She was known for her roles in shows like Worzel Gummidge, Till Death Us Do Part and Sherlock.

item.title: UK police involved for months in embassy spy case - Met boss
item.description: A man working for the British Embassy was arrested near Berlin accused of spying for Russia.

item.title: Streatham attack: Sudesh Amman's victim feared he would bleed to death
item.description: The victim heard the phrase "he's not going to make it" after being stabbed by Sudesh Amman.

item.title: CJ Ujah: British Olympic silver medallist suspended after positive test for banned substance
item.description: British sprinter CJ Ujah is suspended from competition after a positive test for a banned substance.

item.title: NHS waiting list in England hits record 5.45 million
item.description: Hospitals are working through the backlog - but some patients are waiting more than two years.

item.title: KFC warns menu items missing due to supply issues
item.description: The fast food chain has warned customers menus will be missing items as a result of the supply problems.

item.title: 'Slugs and mould' in quarantine hotels as prices rise
item.description: Dirty rooms, bad food and unsafe conditions can be found in some of the UK’s quarantine hotels.

item.title: UK inhaler firm Vectura backs £1bn bid by Marlboro-maker
item.description: The bid by the maker of Marlboro cigarettes trumps a rival offer by US private equity firm Carlyle.

item.title: Half a million EU citizens await decision over right to stay in UK
item.description: More than half a million EU citizens who have applied for settled status in the UK await a decision.

item.title: TV newsreader Victoria Derbyshire overcomes on-air shoe struggle
item.description: The BBC News channel presenter was seen quietly cursing as she struggled to put on her high heels.

item.title: Nick Grimshaw on leaving Radio 1: 'I've interviewed everyone, twice'
item.description: The legendary presenter reflects on leaving BBC Radio 1 after 14 years.

item.title: Northern Turkey hit by severe flash flooding
item.description: Seventeen people have reportedly died, with more than 1,400 people evacuated from the areas affected.

item.title: Life in a town taken by the Taliban in Afghanistan
item.description: BBC correspondent Secunder Kermani reports from a town in Afghanistan recently taken by the Taliban

item.title: Tokyo Olympic gold medal replaced after first got bitten
item.description: The mayor of softball athlete Miu Goto's hometown prompted outrage after chomping on her medal.

item.title: GCSE students praised for 'resilience, commitment and dedication'
item.description: Students have received their GCSE results after coronavirus cancelled exams for a second year.

item.title: Bomb threat arrest at Northampton police station caught on film
item.description: A man is seen being tackled to the ground by officers after claiming he had a bomb in a bag.

item.title: Wildfires rage in Algeria as heatwave hits North Africa
item.description: The blazes in the mountainous Kabylie region are some of the worst in the country's history.

item.title: Uyghur Muslims in London campaign for relatives in China
item.description: Eighteen-year-old Uyghur Muslim Dilnaz and her father are trying to find relatives living in China.

item.title: Berlin embassy arrest: A case of old-school spying?
item.description: Why nothing in the case of the arrest of a man at the British Embassy in Berlin should surprise us.

item.title: Afghanistan war: Taliban back brutal rule as they strike for power
item.description: Afghanistan's ex-rulers still back brutal punishments, the BBC finds as it goes behind Taliban lines.

item.title: How we can all get more high-quality sleep
item.description: The pandemic has led to a sharp increase in insomnia, but some firms are now helping their staff.

item.title: Why is so little sequencing of PCR tests being done?
item.description: The government says sequencing of positive PCR tests for travellers is important.

item.title: How North American cities are bracing for more heatwaves
item.description: Local governments are getting creative when it comes to tackling frequent and extreme heat.

item.title: Afghanistan: The people fleeing the north for safety in Kabul
item.description: The Taliban has taken new territories in the north, forcing thousands out of their homes.

item.title: Lily Allen on making her West End debut in 2:22 - A Ghost Story
item.description: The singer is temporarily pausing her successful music career to star in a brand new play 2:22.

item.title: Sweet Anita: Tourette's queen of Twitch
item.description: Anita broadcasts to thousands every week, playing games whilst talking Tourette's and mental health.

item.title: Wildfires: How are they linked to climate change?
item.description: A series of major wildfires across the world has hit the headlines - how do they compare to previous years?

item.title: National anthem: Should Wales' teams sing God Save the Queen?
item.description: Hen Wlad Fy Nhadau has been sung before Wales rugby internationals for 116 years.

item.title: Superb Rahul century punishes England at Lord's
item.description: England suffer a demoralising first day of the second Test as an unbeaten KL Rahul century leads India towards a huge total at Lord's.

item.title: Ten years on - how much better is Lukaku after re-joining Chelsea
item.description: Why have Chelsea broken their transfer record to re-sign Romelu Lukaku - and how much better is he after returning to the club he first joined in 2011?

item.title: 'They were unreal' - Superchargers hit Hundred's first 200 to hammer local rivals
item.description: Northern Superchargers rack up 200 in an incredible 69-run win over Manchester Originals as the visitors wilt at a raucous Headingley.

item.title: Dominant Celtic coast into Europa League play-offs
item.description: Celtic continue their recent resurgence as they strolled past the Czech Republic's FK Jablonec in the third qualifying round of the Europa League at Celtic Park.

item.title: Chelsea champions? Man City to defend crown? Shearer & BBC pundit team predict Premier League title race
item.description: We ask 20 BBC pundits to predict who will win the Premier League title, who will finish in the top four, and who might break into the top six.

item.title: Aston Martin withdraw appeal against Sebastian Vettel's disqualification in Hungary
item.description: Aston Martin withdraw their appeal against Sebastian Vettel's disqualification from second place in the Hungarian Grand Prix.

item.title: Brave St Johnstone finally fall to Galatasaray
item.description: Brave St Johnstone have their Europa League hopes ended by Turkish giants Galatasaray despite another impressive performance in front of a packed McDiarmid Park.

item.title: GCSE results 2021: Exams triumph for boy who spent year in hospital
item.description: Jason Ledford hopes to become a nurse after undergoing treatment for a brain tumour.

item.title: GCSE results 2021: Will employers judge Covid grades badly? And other questions
item.description: Our experts answer your questions about GCSE results, after a second year without formal exams.

item.title: GCSE results 2021: How were grades decided?
item.description: Teachers have decided their pupils' grades after Covid cancelled exams for a second year.

item.title: GCSEs 2021: The 9-1 grading system explained
item.description: Teenagers will receive their GCSE results on 12 August.

item.title: Exams 2021: 'Will they take our Covid grades seriously?'
item.description: It's been a stressful few months for the thousands of young people waiting for their exam results.

item.title: A-level results: Students have been treated fairly - watchdog
item.description: The head of the exams regulator defends the system for deciding grades ahead of A-level and GCSE results day.

item.title: UK holidays: What are the rules?
item.description: Going abroad is not straightforward, so many people are opting to stay in the UK for their holidays.

item.title: Covid: How do I get a lateral flow or PCR test?
item.description: Everyone in England and Scotland is being encouraged to take rapid coronavirus tests regularly.

item.title: What are the rules and guidance for face masks and coverings?
item.description: Masks are no longer compulsory in England, but remain necessary in other parts of the UK.

item.title: Covid: What do under-30s need to know about the vaccine?
item.description: The government has announced that 16 and 17-year-olds will receive the Covid vaccine.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.
